title: How should I plan to learn Introduction to Algorithms by CLRS entirely by the end of the program? - Quora
tags: Introduction to Algorithms (book by Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest and Stein)

response.answer_text: The answer assumes that the Bachelor's Program is in the discipline of Computer Science. Here is what I think can be a good plan. You will surely get enough time to read this book. But here is what I think will add to your experience and ease the learning process 1) Brush up the basic mathematics, some calculus and linear algebra.2) Brush up discrete mathematics (Discrete Mathematics by Kenneth H Rosen is a good book)3) Make yourself comfortable with some programming language, like C, C++ or Java (a scripting language will suffice for most of the cases if not all) Once you are done with the above, you can follow some advice from my answers here : Dharmendra Prasad's answer to I just bought “CLRS”.
